Karanīyavimāna：A certain layman of Sāvatthi bathed in the Aciravatī，and on his return，seeing the Buddha，invited him to a meal．The Buddha accepted and was waited on with great devotion．As a result the layman was born in Tāvatimsa，in a palace which came to be called Karanīyavimāna．



A further story is told similar to the above，except that the person fed is a monk and not the Buddha （Vv．55； VvA．248f）．
